manuscript_citation: Dyke ALV, Kuhs KAL, Shiels MS, Koshiol J, Trabert B, Loftfield E, Purdue MP, Wentzensen N, Pfeiffer RM, Katki HA, Hildesheim A, Kemp TJ, Pinto LA, Chaturvedi AK, Safaeian M (2017) Associations between self-reported diabetes and 78 circulating markers of inflammation, immunity, and metabolism among adults in the United States. PLoS ONE 12(7): e0182359. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0182359

components.data: PREPARATION OF SAMPLES/REAGENTS FOR IMMUNOASSAY
components.name: Description

source_data.description: PREPARATION OF SAMPLES/REAGENTS FOR IMMUNOASSAY

components.data: Preparation of Serum/Plasma Thaw Time: Thaw the samples completely on ice, mix well by vortexing and centrifuge (10,000 rpm, 10 minutes, 4°C) prior to use in the assay to remove particulates. If samples are in 96 well plates, then thaw the samples completely on ice, mix well by shaking on plate shaker for 1 min. at RT (20-25°C) and centrifuge (1,700 xg, 10 minutes, 4°C) prior to use in the assay to remove particulates.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Preparation of Serum/Plasma Thaw Time: Thaw the samples completely on ice, mix well by vortexing and centrifuge (10,000 rpm, 10 minutes, 4°C) prior to use in the assay to remove particulates. If samples are in 96 well plates, then thaw the samples completely on ice, mix well by shaking on plate shaker for 1 min. at RT (20-25°C) and centrifuge (1,700 xg, 10 minutes, 4°C) prior to use in the assay to remove particulates.

components.data: Preparation of Antibody-Immobilized Beads Sonicate each individual antibody-bead vial for 30 seconds; vortex for 1 minute. Add 60 μL from each antibody-bead vial to the Mixing Bottle and bring final volume to 3.0 mL with Bead Diluent. Vortex the mixed beads well. Unused portion may be stored at 2-8°C for up to one month. (Note: Due to the composition of magnetic beads, you may notice a slight color in the bead solution.  This does not affect the performance of the beads or the kit).Example: When using 15 antibody-immobilized beads, add 60 μL from each of the 15 bead sets to the Mixing Bottle. Then add 2.1 mL Bead Diluent.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Preparation of Antibody-Immobilized Beads Sonicate each individual antibody-bead vial for 30 seconds; vortex for 1 minute. Add 60 μL from each antibody-bead vial to the Mixing Bottle and bring final volume to 3.0 mL with Bead Diluent. Vortex the mixed beads well. Unused portion may be stored at 2-8°C for up to one month. (Note: Due to the composition of magnetic beads, you may notice a slight color in the bead solution.  This does not affect the performance of the beads or the kit).Example: When using 15 antibody-immobilized beads, add 60 μL from each of the 15 bead sets to the Mixing Bottle. Then add 2.1 mL Bead Diluent.

components.data: Preparation of Quality Controls        Reconstitution Time: Before use, reconstitute Quality Control 1 and Quality Control 2 with 250 μL deionized water. Invert the vial several times to mix and vortex. Allow the vial to sit for 5-10 minutes and then transfer the controls to appropriately labeled polypropylene microfuge tubes. Unused portion may be stored at £ -20°C for up to one month.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Preparation of Quality Controls        Reconstitution Time: Before use, reconstitute Quality Control 1 and Quality Control 2 with 250 μL deionized water. Invert the vial several times to mix and vortex. Allow the vial to sit for 5-10 minutes and then transfer the controls to appropriately labeled polypropylene microfuge tubes. Unused portion may be stored at £ -20°C for up to one month.

components.data: Preparation of Wash Buffer Bring the 10X Wash Buffer to room temperature and mix to bring all salts into solution. Dilute 30 mL of 10X Wash Buffer with 270 mL deionized water. Store unused portion at 2-8°C for up to one month.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Preparation of Wash Buffer Bring the 10X Wash Buffer to room temperature and mix to bring all salts into solution. Dilute 30 mL of 10X Wash Buffer with 270 mL deionized water. Store unused portion at 2-8°C for up to one month.

components.data: Preparation of Serum Matrix            Reconstitution Time: Add 1.0 mL deionized water to the bottle containing lyophilized Serum Matrix. Mix well. Allow at least 10 minutes for complete reconstitution. Leftover reconstituted Serum Matrix should be stored at £ -20°C for up to one month.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Preparation of Serum Matrix            Reconstitution Time: Add 1.0 mL deionized water to the bottle containing lyophilized Serum Matrix. Mix well. Allow at least 10 minutes for complete reconstitution. Leftover reconstituted Serum Matrix should be stored at £ -20°C for up to one month.

components.data: Preparation of Human Cytokine Standard Reconstitution Time: 1.) Prior to use, reconstitute the Human Cytokine Standard with 250 μL deionized water to give a 10,000 pg/mL concentration of standard for all analytes. Invert the vial several times to mix. Vortex the vial for 10 seconds. Allow the vial to sit for 5- 10 minutes and then transfer the standard to an appropriately labeled polypropylene microfuge tube. This will be used as the 10,000 pg/mL standard;the unused portion may be stored at £ -20°C for up to one month.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Preparation of Human Cytokine Standard Reconstitution Time: 1.) Prior to use, reconstitute the Human Cytokine Standard with 250 μL deionized water to give a 10,000 pg/mL concentration of standard for all analytes. Invert the vial several times to mix. Vortex the vial for 10 seconds. Allow the vial to sit for 5- 10 minutes and then transfer the standard to an appropriately labeled polypropylene microfuge tube. This will be used as the 10,000 pg/mL standard;the unused portion may be stored at £ -20°C for up to one month.

components.data: ) Preparation of Working Standards. Label six polypropylene microfuge tubes 2000, 400, 80, 16, 3.2, and 0.64 pg/mL.Add 200 μL of Assay Buffer to each of the six tubes.-Prepare serial dilutions by adding 50 μL of the 10,000 pg/mL reconstituted standard to the 2000 pg/mL tube, mix well and transfer 50 μL of the 2000 pg/mL standard to the 400 pg/mL tube, mix well and transfer 50 μL of the 400 pg/mL standard to the 80 pg/mL tube, mix well and transfer 50 μL of the 80 pg/mL standard to 16 pg/mL tube, mix well and transfer 50 μL of the 16 pg/mL standard to the 3.2 pg/mL tube and mix well, transfer 50 μL of the 3.2 pg/mL standard to the 0.64 pg/mL tube and mix well. The 0 pg/mL standard (Background) will be Assay Buffer.Standard Concentration (pg/ml)Volume of Deionized Water to Add (mL)Volume of Standard to Add10,0002500Standard Concentration (pg/ml)Volume of Assay Buffer to Add (mL)Volume of Standard to Add200020050 mL of 10,000 pg/mL40020050 mL of 2000 pg/mL8020050 mL of 400 pg/mL1620050 mL of 80 pg/mL

components.data: Prewet plate by pipetting 200 μL of Wash Buffer into each well of the MAG Plate. Seal and mix on a plate shaker for 10 minutes at room temperature (20-25°C).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prewet plate by pipetting 200 μL of Wash Buffer into each well of the MAG Plate. Seal and mix on a plate shaker for 10 minutes at room temperature (20-25°C).

components.data: Decant Wash Buffer and remove residual amount from all wells by inverting the plate and tapping it smartly onto absorbent towels several times.10) Add 25 μL of each Standard or Control into the appropriate wells. Add 25 μL Assay Buffer to the 0 pg/mL standard (Background).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Decant Wash Buffer and remove residual amount from all wells by inverting the plate and tapping it smartly onto absorbent towels several times.10) Add 25 μL of each Standard or Control into the appropriate wells. Add 25 μL Assay Buffer to the 0 pg/mL standard (Background).

components.data: Add 25 μL of Assay Buffer to the sample wells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 25 μL of Assay Buffer to the sample wells.

components.data: Add 25 μL of the Serum Matrix solution to the background, appropriate standards, and control wells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 25 μL of the Serum Matrix solution to the background, appropriate standards, and control wells.

components.data: Add 25 μL of Sample into the appropriate wells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 25 μL of Sample into the appropriate wells.

components.data: Vortex Mixing Bottle and add 25 μL of the mixed Beads to each well. (Note: During addition of Beads, shake bead bottle intermittently to avoid settling. Due to the composition of magnetic beads, you may notice a slight color in the bead solution. This does not affect the performance of the beads or the kit).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Vortex Mixing Bottle and add 25 μL of the mixed Beads to each well. (Note: During addition of Beads, shake bead bottle intermittently to avoid settling. Due to the composition of magnetic beads, you may notice a slight color in the bead solution. This does not affect the performance of the beads or the kit).

components.data: Seal the plate with a plate sealer, cover it with the lid. Wrap a rubber band around the plate holder, plate and lid and incubate with agitation on a plate shaker overnight (16-18 hrs.) at 4°C (use cold room).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Seal the plate with a plate sealer, cover it with the lid. Wrap a rubber band around the plate holder, plate and lid and incubate with agitation on a plate shaker overnight (16-18 hrs.) at 4°C (use cold room).

components.data: Gently remove fluid by aspiration. Do not invert plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Gently remove fluid by aspiration. Do not invert plate.

components.data: Wash plate 2 times with 200 μL/well of Wash Buffer, removing Wash Buffer by aspiration between each wash. To avoid washing/aspiration related bead loss, allow approximately 60 seconds between dispensing of the Wash Buffer and subsequent aspiration.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash plate 2 times with 200 μL/well of Wash Buffer, removing Wash Buffer by aspiration between each wash. To avoid washing/aspiration related bead loss, allow approximately 60 seconds between dispensing of the Wash Buffer and subsequent aspiration.

components.data: Add 25 μL of Detection Antibodies into each well (Note: Allow the Detection Antibodies to warm to room temperature prior to addition.)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 25 μL of Detection Antibodies into each well (Note: Allow the Detection Antibodies to warm to room temperature prior to addition.)

components.data: Seal, cover with lid, and incubate with agitation on a plate shaker for 1 hour at room temperature (20-25°C). DO NOT ASPIRATE AFTER INCUBATION.20) Add 25 μL Streptavidin-Phycoerythrin to each well containing the 25 μL of Detection Antibodies.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Seal, cover with lid, and incubate with agitation on a plate shaker for 1 hour at room temperature (20-25°C). DO NOT ASPIRATE AFTER INCUBATION.20) Add 25 μL Streptavidin-Phycoerythrin to each well containing the 25 μL of Detection Antibodies.

components.data: Seal, cover with lid and incubate with agitation on a plate shaker for 30 minutes at room temperature (20-25°C).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Seal, cover with lid and incubate with agitation on a plate shaker for 30 minutes at room temperature (20-25°C).

components.data: Gently remove all contents by aspiration. Do not invert plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Gently remove all contents by aspiration. Do not invert plate.

components.data: Wash plate 2 times with 200 μL/well of Wash Buffer, removing Wash Buffer by aspiration between each wash. To avoid washing/aspiration related bead loss, allow approximately 60 seconds between dispensing of the Wash Buffer and subsequent aspiration.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash plate 2 times with 200 μL/well of Wash Buffer, removing Wash Buffer by aspiration between each wash. To avoid washing/aspiration related bead loss, allow approximately 60 seconds between dispensing of the Wash Buffer and subsequent aspiration.

components.data: Add 150 μL of Sheath Fluid to all wells. Resuspend the beads on a plate shaker for 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 150 μL of Sheath Fluid to all wells. Resuspend the beads on a plate shaker for 5 minutes.

components.data: Run plate on Luminex 100™ IS.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run plate on Luminex 100™ IS.

components.data: Save and analyze the data using Bio-Plex Manager software.EQUIPMENT SETTINGSEvents: 50, per bead region  Sample Size: 100 μLGate Settings 5000 to 25,000Time Out 60 secondsQUALITY CONTROLSThe ranges for each analyte in Quality Control 1 and 2 are provided on the card insert or can be located at the MILLIPORE website www.millipore.com/techlibrary/index.do using the catalog number as the keyword.NOTES:Legend: A- Hemolyzed sample; B- Lipemic sample; C- Sample missing; D- Clogged Filter well; E- Low bead count; F- >30% Bead aggregation; G- Instrument repeatProcedure- Quick Reference
